'''Krabby''' ([[List of Japanese Pokémon names|Japanese]]: '''クラブ''' ''Crab'') is a {{type|Water}} {{OBP|Pokémon|species}} introduced in [[Generation I]].

It [[Evolution|evolve]]s into {{p|Kingler}} starting at [[level]] 28.

==Biology==
As a crustacean, Krabby has a strong outer shell protecting its small body. Its upper half is red, containing two small spikes facing upwards on the top of its head. Its lower body is light tan and doubles as its jaw with two fangs overlapping its upper body. Its hips are visible on the lower front of its body connected to its long, thin legs, which have small, claw-like feet. The main feature of Krabby's body is its large, red pincers. Krabby uses them as its main form of offense, and as a form of balance. Sometimes, Krabby may lose a claw during battle, or it can forcibly remove a claw if it is damaged, and regenerate the claw over a short period.

In the wild, Krabby lives {{DL|List of Pokémon by habitat|Water's-edge Pokémon|near the edge of water}} in both fresh and salt water. Krabby is most commonly found on beaches where it burrows in the sand to live. In times of scarce food sources, it may eat sand to regain nutrients, and will be very aggressive in defending its home. Its main form of defense is creating foam to shroud its body, in order to confuse opponents into thinking that it is bigger than it actually is. As seen in [[EP013|the anime]], on average, Krabby generally keeps to itself, but will quickly defend itself if provoked.

==In the anime==
[[File:Krabby anime.png|thumb|220px|Krabby in the {{pkmn|anime}}]]
===Major appearances===
====[[Ash's Kingler|Ash's Krabby]]====
{{Ash}} captured a Krabby in ''[[EP013|Mystery at the Lighthouse]]''. It was transferred to {{an|Professor Oak}}'s [[Professor Oak's Laboratory|lab]], and he didn't use it until ''[[EP075|Round One - Begin!]]''. After defeating an {{p|Exeggutor}} in its first battle, Krabby evolved into {{p|Kingler}}.

====Other====
A Krabby appeared in ''[[EP066|The Evolution Solution]]'', where it grabbed {{p|Slowpoke}}'s tail and {{TP|Misty|Psyduck}}'s head.

A Krabby appeared in ''[[BW087|Expedition to Onix Island!]]''.

===Minor appearances===
{{Gary}}'s [[Size discrepancies in the Pokémon anime|larger-than-average]] Krabby debuted in ''[[EP013|Mystery at the Lighthouse]]''.

A Krabby appeared in ''[[EP017|Island of the Giant Pokémon]]''.

A Krabby appeared in ''[[EP069|Lights, Camera, Quack-tion]]'', as part of the {{wp|film crew}} for the movie "{{DL|Movies in the Pokémon world|Pokémon in Love}}".

A Krabby appeared in a flashback in ''[[EP084|The Lost Lapras]]''.

A Krabby appeared in {{an|Misty}}'s fantasy in ''[[EP091|Bye Bye Psyduck]]''.

Multiple Krabby appeared in ''[[M02|The Power of One]]''.

Two Krabby were part of an exhibition in ''[[EP122|Flower Power]]''.

A Krabby was one of the Pokémon seen at the [[Pokémon Swap Meet]] in ''[[EP146|Tricks of the Trade]]''.

A Trainer used a Krabby in ''[[EP168|Hook, Line, and Stinker]]'' to aid him in the annual {{p|Seaking}} [[Seaking Catching Day|Catching Competition]].

A Krabby appeared in ''[[EP169|Beauty and the Breeder]]'', where it participated in {{pkmn|Beauty Contest|a Pokémon breeding competition}}.

Three Krabby were among the inhabitants of an oasis just for Pokémon in ''[[EP207|Got Miltank?]]''.

A Krabby appeared in ''[[SS020|Pokémon Mystery Dungeon: Explorers of Time & Darkness]]''.

A Krabby appeared in ''[[AG023|Gone Corphishin']]'' in a fantasy.

A Krabby appeared in ''[[DP147|Bagged Then Tagged!]]''.

A Krabby appeared in ''[[DP167|Teaching the Student Teacher!]]'' on the rocks.

A Krabby appeared in ''[[BW127|The Island of Illusions!]]''.

A Krabby appeared in ''[[XY022|Going for the Gold!]]''.

A wild Krabby appeared in ''[[SM042|Alola, Kanto!]]''.

==In the manga==
[[File:Red Krabby Adventures.png|thumb|150px|Krabby in [[Pokémon Adventures]]]]
===In the Pokémon Adventures manga===
During ''[[PS018|A Tale of Ninetales]]'' in [[Pokémon Adventures]], {{adv|Red}} caught a Krabby off-screen while he had some {{adv|Blue}}'s Pokémon in his party by mistake. Later in ''[[PS024|What a Dragonite]]'', after {{HM|03|Surf}} was destroyed Krabby was traded for [[Misty]]'s {{p|Gyarados}}, [[Gyara]], since he already knew how to use Surf. She later appeared again with Misty worrying for Red in ''[[PS044|Do Wrong, Dewgong!]]''.

Another Krabby resides in {{adv|Gold}}'s house in ''[[PS091|Murkrow Row]]''.

Misty later saves a Krabby trapped in [[Tohjo Falls]] in ''[[PS150|Chinchou in Charge]]''. This act of kindness prompts {{p|Suicune}} to pick Misty as its Trainer, besides her being the expert for {{type|Water}} Pokémon.

===In the Pokémon Zensho manga===
{{Zensho|Satoshi}} has a Krabby in the [[Pokémon Zensho]] manga.

===In The Electric Tale of Pikachu manga===
{{main|Ash's Krabby}}
Ash has a Kingler that it was later revealed to have evolved from a Krabby during the Indigo League.

===NPC appearances===
*[[Pokémon Mystery Dungeon: Explorers of Time and Darkness|Pokémon Mystery Dungeon: Explorers of Time, Darkness]] [[Pokémon Mystery Dungeon: Explorers of Sky|& Sky]]: Krabby are known to blow bubbles over the {{mdc|beach|2}} near [[Beach Cave]]. In Sky, when the player and partner access the beach for the first time after clearing [[Mt. Bristle]], one such Krabby will inform them of bottles found at the beach with mail written inside them.

==Trivia==

===Origin===
It is based on a {{wp|crab}}, possibly a {{wp|sand bubbler crab}}.

====Name origin====
Krabby is a corruption of ''crabby'' (grouchy or ill-tempered) and a pun on ''{{wp|crab}}''.

Crab is literally ''crab''.
